alert.note: Alert for St. Helena (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 12 at 9:07PM CDT until May 28 at 3:00PM CDT by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1000 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN ST. HELENA...NORTHWESTERN LIVINGSTON AND NORTHEASTERN EAST BATON ROUGE PARISHES... At 907 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Watson, or 10 miles northeast of Denham Springs, moving southwest at 25 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Denham Springs, Walker, Watson and Greenwell Spring. This includes Interstate 12 between mile markers 10 and 19. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
